item.title: Autonomous/Connected Vehicle Security
item.description: Cybersecurity is one of the biggest threats in autonomous cars as vehicle connectivity is a new paradigm and the technology continues to evolve rapidly. One of the central challenges in vehicle cybersecurity is to secure the communication between various electronic components in a car (known as electronic control units, or ECUs) which are connected via an internal network. If hackers manage to gain access to a vulnerable, peripheral ECU (e.g., the Bluetooth or infotainment system), they may be able to take control of other safety-critical ECUs like brakes or the engine.
